definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
to search/to look for/to seek

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们总是调皮捣蛋寻开心。

sentences.english: No more money left to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 没有多余的钱去寻开心。

sentences.english: The Duke goes where he's amused.
sentences.chinese: 哪里能寻开心，公爵就到哪里去。

sentences.english: Don't let them kid you, big boy .
sentences.chinese: 别让他们拿你寻开心，大孩子。

sentences.english: I was at a night out - only just made the train.
sentences.chinese: 我晚上出去寻开心，差点误了火车。我没有吵醒你吧？

sentences.english: Those stupid boys used to amuse themselves by tossing rocks at passing cars.
sentences.chinese: 那些愚蠢的男孩子过去常朝过往车辆扔石头，寻开心。

sentences.english: They want to be self-sufficiently happy.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢靠自己寻开心。

sentences.english: He made fun of a girl in a wheelchair at his school.
sentences.chinese: 他在学校里还拿一个坐轮椅的小姑娘寻开心。

definition: (coll.) to make fun of (sb)/to play tricks on
(dialect) to joke
to find amusement/to amuse oneself
fun/pleasure/laughing matter
to tease/to make fun of
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
to tease/to play tricks on
to boast
to tease
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
